request.description:
### Register User

This endpoint allows the client to register a new user by providing the necessary details in the request body.

#### Request Body

- `firstName` (text)
    
- `lastName` (text)
    
- `email` (text)
    
- `password` (text)
    
- `phone` (text)
    
- `address` (text)
    
- `role` (text)
    
- `avatar` (file)
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "user": {
            "firstName": "",
            "lastName": "",
            "email": "",
            "password": "",
            "phone": "",
            "address": "",
            "role": "",
            "driverStatus": "",
            "driverCurrentLocation": {
                "type": "",
                "coordinates": [0]
            },
            "avatar": "",
            "_id": "",
            "createdAt": "",
            "token": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    }
}

 ```

### Update User Details

This endpoint allows the client to update user details using an HTTP PUT request.

#### Request Body

- `firstName` (text): The first name of the user.
    
- `lastName` (text): The last name of the user.
    
- `email` (text): The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (text): The password for the user account.
    
- `phone` (text): The phone number of the user.
    
- `address` (text): The address of the user.
    
- `role` (text): The role of the user.
    
- `avatar` (file): The avatar image of the user.
    

#### Response

The response will be in the form of a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "data": {
    "user": {
      "driverCurrentLocation": {
        "type": "",
        "coordinates": [0]
      },
      "_id": "",
      "firstName": "",
      "lastName": "",
      "email": "",
      "password": "",
      "phone": "",
      "address": "",
      "role": "",
      "driverStatus": "",
      "avatar": "",
      "createdAt": "",
      "token": "",
      "__v": 0,
      "stripeCustomerId": ""
    }
  }
}

 ```

### Delete User

This endpoint is used to delete a specific user by their unique identifier.

**Request Body**  
This endpoint does not require a request body.

**Response**

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the request.
    
- `message` (string): Provides additional information about the status of the request.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "message": ""
}

 ```

### Update User Administration Request

This endpoint allows the client to update the status of a specific administration request.

#### Request Body

- `status` (string, required): The new status of the administration request.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "status": "ACCEPT"
}

 ```

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the administration request after the update.
    
- `message` (string): Additional information or message related to the request.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": ""
}
#### Response Time
The response time for this request may vary based on server load and network conditions.

 ```

### Retrieve User Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific user based on the user ID provided in the URL.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{BASE_URL}}/api/users/682df32cba342d0a17c612af`
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "data": {
    "user": {
      "driverCurrentLocation": {
        "type": "string",
        "coordinates": [
          "number"
        ]
      },
      "_id": "string",
      "firstName": "string",
      "lastName": "string",
      "email": "string",
      "phone": "string",
      "address": "string",
      "role": "string",
      "driverStatus": "string",
      "createdAt": "string",
      "token": "string"
    }
  }
}

 ```

The response will contain the user details including first name, last name, email, phone, address, role, driver status, creation timestamp, and a token.

### Get All Orphans of Current Orphanage

This endpoint retrieves a list of orphans belonging to the current orphanage, with the option to limit the number of results and paginate through the list.

#### Request Parameters

- `limit` (query parameter) - The maximum number of orphans to be returned in the response.
    
- `page` (query parameter) - The page number for paginating through the list of orphans.
    

#### Response Body

The response will include an array of orphan objects, each containing the following attributes:

- `_id` (string) - The unique identifier for the orphan.
    
- `name` (string) - The name of the orphan.
    
- `age` (number) - The age of the orphan.
    
- `gender` (string) - The gender of the orphan.
    
- `educationStatus` (string) - The education status of the orphan.
    
- `healthCondition` (string) - The health condition of the orphan.
    
- `orphanage` (object) - Details of the orphanage to which the orphan belongs, including its unique identifier, name, and location.
    
- `orphanageAdmin` (object) - Details of the orphanage administrator, including their unique identifier and email.
    
- `sponsors` (array) - An array of sponsors associated with the orphan.
    
- `photos` (null) - The photos of the orphan (if available).
    
- `createdAt` (string) - The timestamp indicating when the orphan record was created.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "orphans": [
            {
                "_id": "",
                "name": "",
                "age": 0,
                "gender": "",
                "educationStatus": "",
                "healthCondition": "",
                "orphanage": {
                    "_id": "",
                    "name": "",
                    "location": ""
                },
                "orphanageAdmin": {
                    "_id": "",
                    "email": ""
                },
                "sponsors": [],
                "photos": null,
                "createdAt": ""
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Add Orphan

This endpoint allows the user to add a new orphan to the system.

#### Request Body

- `name` (text): The name of the orphan.
    
- `age` (text): The age of the orphan.
    
- `gender` (text): The gender of the orphan.
    
- `educationStatus` (text): The education status of the orphan.
    
- `healthCondition` (text): The health condition of the orphan.
    
- `orphanage` (text): The ID of the orphanage where the orphan resides.
    
- `photos` (file): An array of photos of the orphan.
    

#### Response

- `status`: The status of the response.
    
- `data`
    
    - `orphan`
        
        - `name`: The name of the orphan.
            
        - `age`: The age of the orphan.
            
        - `gender`: The gender of the orphan.
            
        - `educationStatus`: The education status of the orphan.
            
        - `healthCondition`: The health condition of the orphan.
            
        - `orphanage`: The ID of the orphanage where the orphan resides.
            
        - `orphanageAdmin`: The admin of the orphanage.
            
        - `sponsors`: An array of sponsors for the orphan.
            
        - `photos`: An array of photos of the orphan.
            
        - `_id`: The ID of the orphan.
            
        - `createdAt`: The timestamp of when the orphan was created.
            
        - `__v`: Version control.
            
- `message`: Additional information or error message.

### Update Orphan Education Status

This endpoint allows you to update the education status of a specific orphan.

#### Request Body

- `educationStatus` (string, required): The new education status for the orphan.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "educationStatus": "Enrolled"
}

 ```

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the response.
    
- `data` (object): The data object containing the updated orphan details.
    
    - `orphan` (object): The details of the updated orphan.
        
        - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the orphan.
            
        - `name` (string): The name of the orphan.
            
        - `age` (number): The age of the orphan.
            
        - `gender` (string): The gender of the orphan.
            
        - `educationStatus` (string): The updated education status of the orphan.
            
        - `healthCondition` (string): The health condition of the orphan.
            
        - `orphanage` (string): The orphanage where the orphan resides.
            
        - `orphanageAdmin` (string): The admin of the orphanage.
            
        - `sponsors` (array): An array of sponsors for the orphan.
            
        - `photos` (array): An array of photos of the orphan.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The date and time of creation of the orphan record.
            
        - `__v` (number): The version of the orphan record.
            

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "message": "",
    "data": {
        "orphan": {
            "_id": "",
            "name": "",
            "age": 0,
            "gender": "",
            "educationStatus": "",
            "healthCondition": "",
            "orphanage": "",
            "orphanageAdmin": "",
            "sponsors": [],
            "photos": [""],
            "createdAt": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
# Get Orphan Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific orphan based on the provided orphan ID.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET /api/orphans/682e138fb7bd42c55e5995e2`

### Response Body

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `data` (object)
    
    - `orphan` (object)
        
        - `_id` (string): The unique ID of the orphan.
            
        - `name` (string): The name of the orphan.
            
        - `age` (number): The age of the orphan.
            
        - `gender` (string): The gender of the orphan.
            
        - `educationStatus` (string): The education status of the orphan.
            
        - `healthCondition` (string): The health condition of the orphan.
            
        - `orphanage` (object)
            
            - `_id` (string): The unique ID of the orphanage where the orphan resides.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the orphanage.
                
            - `location` (string): The location of the orphanage.
                
        - `orphanageAdmin` (object)
            
            - `_id` (string): The unique ID of the orphanage admin.
                
            - `email` (string): The email of the orphanage admin.
                
        - `sponsors` (array): An array of sponsors for the orphan.
            
        - `photos` (array): An array of photos of the orphan.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the orphan record was created.
            
        - `__v` (number): Version control.
            

## Example

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "orphan": {
            "_id": "",
            "name": "",
            "age": 0,
            "gender": "",
            "educationStatus": "",
            "healthCondition": "",
            "orphanage": {
                "_id": "",
                "name": "",
                "location": ""
            },
            "orphanageAdmin": {
                "_id": "",
                "email": ""
            },
            "sponsors": [],
            "photos": [""],
            "createdAt": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    }
}

 ```

### Get Orphanages

This endpoint retrieves a list of orphanages with the option to limit the number of results and paginate through the data.

**Request**

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `{{BASE_URL}}/api/orphanages`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - `limit` (integer, optional): The maximum number of orphanages to retrieve.
        
    - `page` (integer, optional): The page number for paginating through the results.
        

**Response**  
The response will include the status of the request and the orphanage data. Each orphanage object contains the following properties:

- `_id` (string): The unique identifier for the orphanage.
    
- `name` (string): The name of the orphanage.
    
- `location` (string): The location of the orphanage.
    
- `description` (string): A brief description of the orphanage.
    
- `admin` (object): Details of the admin associated with the orphanage, including their unique identifier and email.
    
- `orphans` (array): An array of unique identifiers for the orphans associated with the orphanage.
    
- `status` (string): The status of the orphanage.
    
- `verified` (boolean): Indicates whether the orphanage is verified.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the orphanage was created.
    
- `donations` (array): An array of unique identifiers for the donations associated with the orphanage.
    
- `drivers` (array): An array of unique identifiers for the drivers associated with the orphanage.
    
- `supportPrograms` (array): An array of unique identifiers for the support programs associated with the orphanage.
    

**Example Response**

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "orphanages": [
            {
                "contact": {
                    "phone": "",
                    "email": ""
                },
                "_id": "",
                "name": "",
                "location": "",
                "description": "",
                "admin": {
                    "_id": "",
                    "email": ""
                },
                "orphans": [""],
                "status": "",
                "verified": true,
                "createdAt": "",
                "donations": [""],
                "drivers": [""],
                "supportPrograms": [""]
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Update Orphanage Details

This endpoint allows the user to update the details of a specific orphanage by sending an HTTP PATCH request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body

- `description` (string, required): A brief description of the orphanage.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "description": "A safe home for orphaned children with caring staff and educational facilities."
}

 ```

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message regarding the response.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing the updated details of the orphanage.
    
    - `orphanage` (object): Details of the updated orphanage.
        
        - `contact` (object): Contact details of the orphanage.
            
            - `phone` (string): Phone number of the orphanage.
                
            - `email` (string): Email address of the orphanage.
                
        - `_id` (string): Unique identifier of the orphanage.
            
        - `name` (string): Name of the orphanage.
            
        - `location` (string): Location of the orphanage.
            
        - `description` (string): Updated description of the orphanage.
            
        - `admin` (string): Administrator of the orphanage.
            
        - `orphans` (array): List of orphans in the orphanage.
            
        - `status` (string): Status of the orphanage.
            
        - `verified` (boolean): Indicates if the orphanage is verified.
            
        - `donations` (array): List of donations received by the orphanage.
            
        - `supportPrograms` (array): List of support programs available at the orphanage.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): Date and time of creation.
            
        - `__v` (number): Version of the orphanage details.
            

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "message": "Orphanage details updated successfully.",
    "data": {
        "orphanage": {
            "contact": {
                "phone": "123-456-7890",
                "email": "contact@example.com"
            },
            "_id": "682df9a9ba342d0a17c612cc",
            "name": "Sunshine Orphanage",
            "location": "City, Country",
            "description": "A safe home for orphaned children with caring staff and educational facilities.",
            "admin": "Admin Name",
            "orphans": [],
            "status": "active",
            "verified": true,
            "donations": [],
            "supportPrograms": [],
            "createdAt": "2022-01-01T12:00:00Z",
            "__v": 0
        }
    }
}

 ```

# Get Orphanage Applications

This endpoint retrieves a list of orphanage applications.

## Request

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Request Parameters

This request does not require any parameters.

## Response

### Response Body

The response body will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "status": "string",
    "data": {
        "orphanages": [
            {
                "contact": {
                    "phone": "string",
                    "email": "string"
                },
                "_id": "string",
                "name": "string",
                "location": "string",
                "description": "string",
                "admin": "string",
                "orphans": ["string"],

                "verified": true,

}
 ```

### Get Volunteer Applications Requests

This endpoint retrieves a list of volunteer application requests from the server.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

- `data` (object)
    
    - `requests` (array): An array of volunteer application request objects.
        
        - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the request.
            
        - `orphanage` (object)
            
            - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the orphanage.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the orphanage.
                
            - `location` (string): The location of the orphanage.
                
        - `description` (string): The description of the volunteer request.
            
        - `requiredSkills` (string): The skills required for the volunteer request.
            
        - `requiredServiceType` (string): The type of service required for the volunteer request.
            
        - `status` (string): The status of the volunteer request.
            
        - `applicationCount` (number): The count of applications received for the request.
            
        - `maxVolunteers` (number): The maximum number of volunteers required for the request.
            
        - `acceptedCount` (number): The count of accepted volunteers for the request.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the request was created.

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of service types for volunteer applications. The request does not require any parameters in the request body or URL.

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the response.
    
- `data` (object): Contains the response data.
    
    - `serviceTypes` (array of strings): An array of service types available for volunteer applications.
        

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "serviceTypes": [""]
    }
}

 ```

### Get Volunteer Requests for Orphanage

This endpoint retrieves the volunteer requests for a specific orphanage based on the provided orphanage ID.

#### Request Body

This is a GET request and does not require a request body.

#### Response Body

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `data` (object):
    
    - `requests` (array): An array of volunteer request objects containing the following fields:
        
        - `_id` (string): The ID of the volunteer request.
            
        - `orphanage` (object):
            
            - `_id` (string): The ID of the orphanage.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the orphanage.
                
            - `location` (string): The location of the orphanage.
                
        - `description` (string): The description of the volunteer request.
            
        - `requiredSkills` (string): The required skills for the volunteer request.
            
        - `requiredServiceType` (string): The required service type for the volunteer request.
            
        - `status` (string): The status of the volunteer request.
            
        - `applicationCount` (number): The count of applications received for the volunteer request.
            
        - `maxVolunteers` (number): The maximum number of volunteers required for the request.
            
        - `acceptedCount` (number): The count of accepted volunteers for the request.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of the request creation.
            
        - `__v` (number): Version control field.

request.description:
### GET /api/volunteer/applications/volunteer-requests/orphanage/{orphanageId}

This endpoint retrieves volunteer requests for a specific orphanage, filtered by service type.

#### Request

- Path Parameters
    
    - `orphanageId` (string, required) - The ID of the orphanage for which volunteer requests are to be retrieved.
        
- Query Parameters
    
    - `serviceType` (string, required) - Filter the volunteer requests by the type of service.
        

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "data": {
    "requests": [
      {
        "_id": "string",
        "orphanage": {
          "_id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "location": "string"
        },
        "description": "string",
        "requiredSkills": "string",
        "requiredServiceType": "string",
        "status": "string",
        "applicationCount": 0,
        "maxVolunteers": 0,
        "acceptedCount": 0,
        "createdAt": "string",
        "__v": 0
      }
    ]
  }
}

 ```

The `requests` array contains objects representing individual volunteer requests. Each request object includes details such as ID, orphanage information, description, required skills, service type, status, application count, maximum volunteers, accepted count, and creation timestamp.

request.description:
### Apply for Volunteer Application

This endpoint allows you to apply for a volunteer application.

#### Request Body

- `serviceType` (string, required): The type of service you are applying for.
    
- `message` (string, required): A message describing your qualifications or interest.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message accompanying the response status.
    
- `data` (object): The data object containing the application details.
    
    - `application` (object): The details of the volunteer application.
        
        - `volunteer` (string): The volunteer's information.
            
        - `volunteerRequest` (string): The volunteer request details.
            
        - `serviceType` (string): The type of service applied for.
            
        - `orphanage` (string): The orphanage related to the application.
            
        - `message` (string): The message provided in the application.
            
        - `status` (string): The status of the application.
            
        - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the application.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of the application creation.
            
        - `__v` (number): The version of the application data.
            

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "application": {
      "volunteer": "",
      "volunteerRequest": "",
      "serviceType": "",
      "orphanage": "",
      "message": "",
      "status": "",
      "_id": "",
      "createdAt": "",
      "__v": 0
    }
  }
}

 ```

request.description:
This endpoint is used to delete a specific volunteer application by providing its unique identifier in the URL. The request does not require a request body. Upon successful deletion, the endpoint returns a JSON response with a status and message indicating the outcome of the operation.

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response

- `status` (string): Indicates the status of the operation, such as success or failure.
    
- `message` (string): Provides additional information about the outcome of the operation.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
    "status": "success",
    "message": "Volunteer application deleted successfully."
}

 ```

request.description:
### GET /api/donations/mine

This endpoint retrieves the donations associated with the authenticated user.

#### Request

No request body is required for this GET request.

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "message": "string",
  "data": {
    "donations": [
      {
        "_id": "string",
        "fee": 0,
        "netAmount": 0,
        "donor": {
          "_id": "string",
          "firstName": "string",
          "lastName": "string",
          "role": "string"
        },
        "category": "string",
        "donationType": "string",
        "amount": 0,
        "transactionId": "string",
        "status": "string",
        "orphanage": "string or null",
        "campaign": "string or null",
        "createdAt": "string",
        "books": ["string"],
        "clothes": ["string"],
        "food": ["string"],
        "material": ["string"],
        "__v": 0
      }
    ]
  }
}

 ```

The `donations` array contains objects representing individual donations, with details such as ID, fee, net amount, donor information, category, donation type, amount, transaction ID, status, orphanage, campaign, creation timestamp, and associated items like books, clothes, food, and material.

request.description:
The endpoint `{{BASE_URL}}/api/donations/educational-support/books` is a POST request used to submit donations for educational support in the form of books to a specific orphanage. The request payload should include an array of books with their names and quantities, along with the ID of the orphanage receiving the donation.

### Request Body

- `books` (array): An array of objects containing the name and quantity of each book being donated.
    
    - `name` (string): The name of the book being donated.
        
    - `quantity` (number): The quantity of the book being donated.
        
- `orphanage` (string): The ID of the orphanage receiving the donation.
    

### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "donation": {
      "fee": 0,
      "donor": "",
      "category": "",
      "donationType": "",
      "amount": 0,
      "transactionId": "",
      "status": "",
      "orphanage": "",
      "books": [
        {
          "name": "",
          "quantity": 0,
          "_id": ""
        }
      ],
      "campaign": null,
      "_id": "",
      "netAmount": 0,
      "createdAt": "",
      "clothes": [],
      "food": [],
      "material": [],
      "__v": 0
    }
  }
}

 ```

This schema represents the structure of the response object, with placeholders for the actual values returned. The `books` array within the `donation` object will contain objects with the name, quantity, and ID of each donated book.

request.description:
The endpoint `{{BASE_URL}}/api/donations/educational-support/financial` is a POST request used to make a donation for educational support in the form of financial assistance. The request body should include the amount of the donation and the orphanage identifier.

### Request Body

- `amount` (number): The amount of the donation.
    
- `orphanage` (string): The identifier of the orphanage.
    

### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the donation request.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the donation request.
    
- `data` (object):
    
    - `donationId` (string): The identifier of the donation.
        
    - `checkoutUrl` (string): The URL for the donation checkout.

This endpoint allows you to make an HTTP POST request to donate financial aid for medical purposes. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type with the "amount" representing the donation amount and "orphanage" representing the identifier of the orphanage.

### Request Body

- `amount` (number): The amount of financial aid being donated.
    
- `orphanage` (string): The identifier of the orphanage for which the donation is being made.
    

### Response

The response will include the following fields:

- `status` (string): The status of the donation request.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the donation status.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing additional donation details.
    
    - `donationId` (string): The unique identifier for the donation.
        
    - `checkoutUrl` (string): The URL for the donation checkout process.
        

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "message": "",
    "data": {
        "donationId": "",
        "checkoutUrl": ""
    }
}

 ```

### Add Educational Support Material Donation

This endpoint allows the user to make a donation of educational support material to a specific orphanage.

#### Request Body

- `material` (array of objects, required): An array containing the type and quantity of educational support material being donated.
    
    - `type` (string): The type of material being donated.
        
    - `quantity` (number): The quantity of the material being donated.
        
- `orphanage` (string, required): The ID of the orphanage receiving the donation.
    

Example request body:

``` json
{
  "material": [
    {
      "type": "erasers",
      "quantity": 30
    }
  ],
  "orphanage": "67cdf7502135feb39e5aaed8"
}

 ```

#### Response

- `status` (string): The status of the donation request.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the donation request.
    
- `data` (object): The donation details.
    
    - `donation` (object): Details of the donation made.
        
        - `fee` (number): The fee associated with the donation.
            
        - `donor` (string): The donor's information.
            
        - `category` (string): The category of the donation.
            
        - `donationType` (string): The type of donation made.
            
        - `amount` (number): The amount of the donation.
            
        - `transactionId` (string): The transaction ID associated with the donation.
            
        - `status` (string): The status of the donation.
            
        - `orphanage` (string): The ID of the orphanage receiving the donation.
            
        - `material` (array of objects): The details of the donated materials.
            
            - `type` (string): The type of material donated.
                
            - `quantity` (number): The quantity of the material donated.
                
            - `_id` (string): The ID of the material donation entry.
                
        - `campaign` (string): The campaign associated with the donation.
            
        - `_id` (string): The ID of the donation entry.
            
        - `netAmount` (number): The net amount of the donation.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of the donation creation.
            
        - `books` (array): Details of donated books.
            
        - `clothes` (array): Details of donated clothes.
            
        - `food` (array): Details of donated food.
            
        - `__v` (number): Version of the donation details.
            

Example response:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "donation": {
      "fee": 0,
      "donor": "",
      "category": "",
      "donationType": "",
      "amount": 0,
      "transactionId": "",
      "status": "",
      "orphanage": "",
      "material": [
        {
          "type": "",
          "quantity": 0,
          "_id": ""
        }
      ],
      "campaign": null,
      "_id": "",
      "netAmount": 0,
      "createdAt": "",
      "books": [],
      "clothes": [],
      "food": [],
      "__v": 0
    }
  }
}

 ```

#### Response

``` json
{
 ```

request.description:
### Patch Orphanage Application Rejection

This endpoint is used to reject an orphanage application by sending an HTTP PATCH request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body

- email (text, required): The email of the applicant.
    
- password (text, required): The password of the applicant.
    

#### Response

- status (string): The status of the response.
    
- message (string): A message related to the response.
    
- data (object):
    
    - application (object):
        
        - _id (string): The ID of the application.
            
        - volunteer (string): The volunteer associated with the application.
            
        - volunteerRequest (object):
            
            - _id (string): The ID of the volunteer request.
                
            - orphanage (string): The orphanage related to the volunteer request.
                
            - description (string): Description of the volunteer request.
                
            - requiredSkills (string): Skills required for the volunteer request.
                
            - requiredServiceType (string): Service type required for the volunteer request.
                
            - status (string): The status of the volunteer request.
                
            - applicationCount (number): The count of applications for the volunteer request.
                
            - maxVolunteers (number): The maximum number of volunteers required.
                
            - acceptedCount (number): The count of accepted volunteers.
                
            - createdAt (string): The timestamp of creation.
                
            - __v (number): Version control.
                
        - serviceType (string): The type of service.
            
        - orphanage (string): The orphanage related to the application.
            
        - message (string): A message related to the application status.
            
        - status (string): The status of the application.
            
        - createdAt (string): The timestamp of creation.
            
        - __v (number): Version control.

request.description:
### Create Driver Route for Delivery Request

This endpoint allows you to create a driver route for a specific delivery request.

#### Request Body

- `deliveryId` (string) - The ID of the delivery for which the driver route needs to be created.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "deliveryId": "682eec6891938fd519d45eca"
}

 ```

#### Response

- `status` (string) - The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string) - Additional information or error message.
    
- `data`
    
    - `mapLink` (string) - The link to the map for the created driver route.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "mapLink": ""
  }
}

 ```

### API Request Description

The HTTP POST request to `{{BASE_URL}}/api/controlling-donations/682e2fe81093c94f9d278c4c/control` is used to control the donations. The request body should be in raw format and include the following parameters:

- `usageSummary` (text): A summary of the usage of the tools.
    
- `photos` (file): An array of photos related to the distribution.
    
- `notes` (text): Additional notes about the distribution supervision.
    

### API Response

The response for this request is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "controllingRecord": {
      "donation": "",
      "orphanage": "",
      "controlledBy": "",
      "usageSummary": "",
      "orphansImpacted": [],
      "photos": [""],
      "notes": "",
      "_id": "",
      "controlDate": "",
      "__v": 0
    }
  }
}

 ```

The `data` object contains a `controllingRecord` with various properties related to the controlled donation, including details about the donation, orphanage, usage summary, photos, notes, and control date.

### API Request Description

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of controlling donations.

### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

### Response Body

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "status": "string",
  "results": 0,
  "data": {
    "records": [
      {
        "_id": "string",
        "donation": {
          "amount": 0,
          "_id": "string",
          "fee": 0,
          "netAmount": 0,
          "donor": "string",
          "category": "string",
          "donationType": "string",
          "transactionId": "string",
          "status": "string",
          "orphanage": "string",
          "books": [
            {
              "name": "string",
              "quantity": 0,
              "_id": "string"
            }
          ],
          "campaign": "null or object",
          "createdAt": "string",
          "clothes": ["string"],
          "food": ["string"],
          "material": ["string"],
          "__v": 0
        },
        "orphanage": {
          "contact": {
            "phone": "string",
            "email": "string"
          },
          "_id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "location": "string",
          "description": "string",
          "admin": "string",
          "orphans": ["string"],
          "status": "string",
          "verified": true,
          "createdAt": "string",
          "__v": 0,
          "donations": ["string"],
          "drivers": ["string"],
          "supportPrograms": ["string"]
        },
        "controlledBy": {
          "_id": "string",
          "email": "string"
        },
        "usageSummary": "string",
        "orphansImpacted": ["string"],
        "photos": ["string"],
        "notes": "string",
        "controlDate": "string",
        "__v": 0
      }
    ]
  }
}

 ```

The response will contain the status, number of results, and an array of records, each containing detailed information about controlled donations, including donation details, orphanage information, and control details.

- `data` (object)
    
    - `controlRecords` (array): An array of control records associated with the donor.

request.description:
### Get Donor Dashboard Summary

This endpoint retrieves a summary of the donor dashboard.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{BASE_URL}}/api/dashboard/donor/summary`
    

#### Response

The response will contain the following fields:

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `data` (object):
    
    - `donationCountByType` (object): The count of donations by type, including Financial, Material, Food, and Clothes.
        
    - `controlCountByType` (object): The count of control items by type.
        

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "donationCountByType": {
            "Financial": 0,
            "Material": 0,
            "Food": 0,
            "Clothes": 0
        },
        "controlCountByType": {}
    }
}

 ```

# Export Fees for Donations (Admin)

give all information of financial donation from donar

This endpoint retrieves the export fees for donations in the system.

## Request

### Query Parameters

- No query parameters required.
    

### Response

The response for this request is an array of objects, each representing a donation export fee. The response schema for the array of objects is as follows:

``` json
[
  {
    "id": "string",
    "donation_id": "string",
    "fee_amount": "number",
    "currency": "string",
    "created_at": "string",
    "updated_at": "string"
  }
]

 ```

Each object in the array contains the following properties:

- `id`: The unique identifier for the export fee.
    
- `donation_id`: The identifier for the donation associated with the export fee.
    
- `fee_amount`: The amount of the export fee.
    
- `currency`: The currency in which the fee is represented.
    
- `created_at`: The timestamp indicating when the export fee was created.
    
- `updated_at`: The timestamp indicating when the export fee was last updated.
    

Example response:

``` json
[
  {
    "id": "abc123",
    "donation_id": "xyz789",
    "fee_amount": 25.00,
    "currency": "USD",
    "created_at": "2022-01-01T12:00:00Z",
    "updated_at": "2022-01-02T10:00:00Z"
  }
]

 ```

### Get Settings

This endpoint retrieves the current settings from the server.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{BASE_URL}}/api/settings`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example response body:

``` json
{
    "status": "",
    "data": {
        "_id": "",
        "transactionFeePercent": 0,
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

### Update Settings

This endpoint allows the client to update the settings by sending an HTTP PATCH request to `{{BASE_URL}}/api/settings`.

#### Request Body

- `transactionFeePercent` (number) - The new transaction fee percentage.
    

#### Response

- `status` (string) - The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string) - A message related to the response.

### Create Support Program

This endpoint allows you to create a new support program.

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): The name of the program.
    
- `description` (string, required): A brief description of the program.
    
- `orphanage` (string, required): The ID of the orphanage associated with the program.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "name": "Health Awareness Program",
  "description": "A community-based program to raise awareness about health issues.",
  "orphanage": "67ccc69ad7fbcd19a9fc8ebc"
}

 ```

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following properties:

- `status` (string): The status of the response.
    
- `message` (string): A message related to the response status.
    
- `data` (object): An object containing the program details.
    
    - `program` (object): An object with the following properties:
        
        - `name` (string): The name of the program.
            
        - `description` (string): A brief description of the program.
            
        - `orphanage` (string): The ID of the orphanage associated with the program.
            
        - `createdBy` (string): The user who created the program.
            
        - `_id` (string): The unique ID of the program.
            
        - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of when the program was created.
            
        - `__v` (number): Version control field.
            

Example:

``` json
{
  "status": "",
  "message": "",
  "data": {
    "program": {
      "name": "",
      "description": "",
      "orphanage": "",
      "createdBy": "",
      "_id": "",
      "createdAt": "",
      "__v": 0
    }
  }
}

 ```
